definitions.definition: transfer (a figure) to an adjacent column during an arithmetical operation (e.g. when a column of digit adds up to more than ten).
support and move (someone or something) from one place to another.
definitions.example: medics were carrying a wounded man on a stretcher

definitions.definition: support the weight of.
definitions.example: the bridge is capable of carrying even the heaviest loads

definitions.definition: (of a sound, ball, missile, etc.) reach a specified point.
definitions.example: his voice carried clearly across the room

definitions.definition: assume or accept (responsibility or blame).
definitions.example: they must carry management responsibility for the mess they have got the company into

definitions.definition: stand and move in a specified way.
definitions.example: she carried herself straight and with assurance

definitions.definition: have as a feature or consequence.
definitions.example: being a combat sport, karate carries with it the risk of injury

definitions.definition: approve (a proposed measure) by a majority of votes.
definitions.example: the resolution was carried by a two-to-one majority

definitions.definition: succeed in achieving (something that one has worked for).
definitions.example: clarify your objectives and ways of attaining them

definitions.definition: distribute (resources or duties) for a particular purpose.
definitions.example: in past years we didn't allocate enough funds to infrastructure maintenance

definitions.definition: meet the expectations, needs, or desires of (someone).
definitions.example: I have never been satisfied with my job

definitions.definition: provide (someone) with adequate or convincing information or proof about something.
definitions.example: people need to be satisfied that the environmental assessments are accurate

definitions.definition: state a fact or belief confidently and forcefully.
definitions.example: the company asserts that the cuts will not affect development

definitions.definition: the provision of what is necessary for the health, welfare, maintenance, and protection of someone or something.
definitions.example: the care of the elderly

definitions.definition: serious attention or consideration applied to doing something correctly or to avoid damage or risk.
definitions.example: he planned his departure with great care

definitions.definition: feel concern or interest; attach importance to something.
definitions.example: they don't care about human life

definitions.definition: look after and provide for the needs of.
definitions.example: he has numerous animals to care for

definitions.definition: make (someone) afraid or anxious.
definitions.example: the savagery of his thoughts frightened him

definitions.definition: allocate (a job or duty).
definitions.example: Congress had assigned the task to the agency

definitions.definition: transfer (legal rights or liabilities).
definitions.example: they will ask you to assign your rights against the airline

definitions.definition: designate or set (something) aside for a specific purpose.
definitions.example: managers happily assign large sums of money to travel budgets

definitions.definition: identify (someone or something) from having encountered them before; know again.
definitions.example: I recognized her when her wig fell off

definitions.definition: acknowledge the existence, validity, or legality of.
definitions.example: the defence is recognized in British law

definitions.definition: collide with (someone or something), giving them a hard blow.
definitions.example: he deliberately ran against her, knocking her shoulder

definitions.definition: strike a surface noisily to attract attention, especially when waiting to be let in through a door.
definitions.example: he strolled over and knocked on a door marked Enquiries

definitions.definition: experience or be subjected to (something bad or unpleasant).
definitions.example: he suffered intense pain

definitions.definition: suspend or be suspended from above with the lower part dangling free.
definitions.example: that's where people are supposed to hang their washing

definitions.definition: remain static in the air.
definitions.example: a black pall of smoke hung over Valletta

definitions.definition: kill (someone) by tying a rope attached from above around their neck and removing the support from beneath them (often used as a form of capital punishment).
definitions.example: he was hanged for murder

definitions.definition: a written or spoken agreement, especially one concerning employment, sales, or tenancy, that is intended to be enforceable by law.
definitions.example: he has just signed a contract keeping him with the club

definitions.definition: decrease in size, number, or range.
definitions.example: glass contracts as it cools

definitions.definition: enter into a formal and legally binding agreement.
definitions.example: the local authority will contract with a wide range of agencies to provide services

definitions.definition: catch or develop (a disease or infectious agent).
definitions.example: three people contracted a killer virus

definitions.definition: become liable to pay (a debt).
definitions.example: he contracted a debt of Â£3,300

definitions.definition: be or remain in a particular position or state.
definitions.example: the fridge was sitting in a pool of water

definitions.definition: (of a parliament, committee, court of law, etc.) be engaged in its business.
definitions.example: Parliament continued sitting until March 16

definitions.definition: adopt or be in a position in which one's weight is supported by one's buttocks rather than one's feet and one's back is upright.
definitions.example: you'd better sit down

definitions.definition: give work to (someone) and pay them for it.
definitions.example: the firm employs 150 people

definitions.definition: make use of.
definitions.example: the methods they have employed to collect the data

definitions.definition: the state of being employed for wages or a salary.
definitions.example: I started work in the employ of a grocer

definitions.definition: receive (money, property, or a title) as an heir at the death of the previous holder.
definitions.example: she inherited a fortune from her father

definitions.definition: derive (a quality, characteristic, or predisposition) genetically from one's parents or ancestors.
definitions.example: inherited diseases

definitions.definition: receive or be left with (a situation, object, etc.) from a predecessor or former owner.
definitions.example: spending commitments inherited from previous governments

definitions.definition: be unsuccessful in achieving one's goal.
definitions.example: he failed in his attempt to secure election

definitions.definition: neglect to do something.
definitions.example: the firm failed to give adequate risk warnings

definitions.definition: cease to work properly; break down.
definitions.example: a lorry whose brakes had failed

definitions.definition: a mark which is not high enough to pass an examination or test.
definitions.example: a fail grade

definitions.definition: combine or put together to form one substance or mass.
definitions.example: peppercorns are sometimes mixed with other spices

definitions.definition: (of a person) associate with others socially.
definitions.example: the people he mixed with were nothing to do with show business

definitions.definition: (especially in sound recording) combine (two or more signals or soundtracks) into one.
definitions.example: up to eight tracks can be mixed simultaneously

definitions.definition: take a brief or hurried look.
definitions.example: Ginny glanced at her watch

definitions.definition: hit something at an angle and bounce off obliquely.
definitions.example: the stone glanced off a crag and hit Tom on the head

definitions.definition: a brief or hurried look.
definitions.example: I stole a glance at John

definitions.definition: a long, partially curved rod with horsehair stretched along its length, used for playing the violin and other stringed instruments.
play (a stringed instrument or music) using a bow.
definitions.example: the techniques by which the pieces were bowed

definitions.definition: bend the head or upper part of the body as a sign of respect, greeting, or shame.
definitions.example: he turned and bowed to his father

definitions.definition: bend with age or under pressure.
definitions.example: the roof trusses bowed as the wind fought to rip the roof free

definitions.definition: the front end of a ship.
definitions.example: water sprayed high over her bows

definitions.definition: a weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood joined at both ends by a taut string.
definitions.example: swifter than an arrow from an archer's bow

definitions.definition: a metal ring forming the handle of a key or pair of scissors.
a knot tied with two loops and two loose ends, used especially for tying shoelaces and decorative ribbons.
definitions.example: a girl with long hair tied back in a bow

definitions.definition: a curved stroke forming part of a letter (e.g. b, p ).
an act of bending the head or upper body as a sign of respect or greeting.
definitions.example: the man gave a little bow
